name: Bee Sting
commonSymptoms: Pain, redness, swelling at the sting site (normal reaction)
Swelling of the throat and tongue

prevalence.general: Around 1-5% of adults have had a severe reaction

name: Wasp Sting
commonSymptoms: Similar to bee sting allergy symptoms, ranging from mild to severe anaphylaxis

name: Fire Ant Sting
commonSymptoms: Painful red bumps that develop into pus-filled blisters

prevalence.Southern USA: Common in regions with fire ants

name: Hornet Sting
commonSymptoms: Similar to bee and wasp sting allergies, can be severe

prevalence.general: Less common than bee or wasp allergy

medicalName: Hymenoptera venom allergy (Dolichovespula maculata, Vespa crabro)

name: Yellow Jacket Sting
commonSymptoms: Similar to other stinging insect allergies, often with rapid onset

prevalence.general: Common cause of stinging insect allergy

medicalName: Hymenoptera venom allergy (Vespula squamosa, Vespula vulgaris)

name: Mosquito Bite Allergy

prevalence.general: Relatively common for local reactions, severe allergy is rare

treatment: Antihistamines, topical corticosteroids, cold compress, avoidance

name: Flea Bite Allergy
commonSymptoms: Itchy red bumps, often in clusters
treatment: Topical corticosteroids, antihistamines, avoidance, treating pets

name: Bed Bug Bite Allergy
commonSymptoms: Itchy red welts, often in a line or cluster
treatment: Topical corticosteroids, antihistamines, avoidance, pest control

name: Biting Fly Allergy (Horsefly, Deerfly)

prevalence.general: Common in areas with these flies

treatment: Cold compress, topical corticosteroids, antihistamines, avoidance

name: Gnat Bite Allergy
treatment: Topical corticosteroids, antihistamines, cold compress, avoidance

prevalence.General: Less common than other insect allergies
Less common than other insect allergies

name: Caterpillar Allergy (Contact Dermatitis)
commonSources: Various caterpillar species with irritating hairs or spines
treatment: Washing the area, applying tape to remove hairs, topical corticosteroids, antihistamines

name: Ant Allergy (excluding Fire Ants)
commonSymptoms: Local reaction at the bite/sting site

prevalence.General: Less common than fire ant allergy

treatment: Antihistamines, topical corticosteroids, epinephrine auto-injector (if severe)

name: Spider Bite Allergy
commonSymptoms: Systemic reactions (rare, except for venomous spiders)

prevalence.General: Allergic reactions to non-venomous spider bites are rare

treatment: Cold compress, pain relievers, antihistamines (if allergic reaction)

name: Tick Bite Allergy (including Alpha-gal Syndrome)
commonSymptoms: Local reaction at the bite site
Alpha-gal syndrome symptoms (delayed allergic reaction to red meat)

prevalence.Regional: Prevalence varies by tick species and location

treatment: Avoidance, antihistamines, epinephrine auto-injector (if severe), avoidance of red meat (for alpha-gal)

name: Ear Mite Allergy (in pets, affecting humans indirectly)
commonSymptoms: Indirectly through pet dander and scratching
treatment: Treating pets, managing pet dander allergy

name: Carpenter Bee Sting Allergy
commonSymptoms: Similar to other bee sting allergies

name: Sweat Bee Sting Allergy
commonSymptoms: Similar to other bee sting allergies, usually milder

name: Bumblebee Sting Allergy
commonSymptoms: Similar to other bee sting allergies

name: Paper Wasp Sting Allergy
commonSymptoms: Similar to other wasp sting allergies

name: Giant Water Bug Allergy
commonSymptoms: Painful bite, potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Water Scorpion Allergy
commonSymptoms: Painful bite, potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Dobsonfly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Painful bite, potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Hellgrammite Allergy
commonSymptoms: Painful bite, potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Alderfly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Fishfly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Scorpionfly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Hangingfly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Snowfly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Icefly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Water Bug Allergy (excluding Giant Water Bugs)
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Diving Beetle Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Whirligig Beetle Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Riffle Beetle Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Water Penny Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Hellgrammite Fly Allergy (Adult Dobsonfly)
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Alderfly Larvae Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Fishfly Larvae Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Crane Fly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Potential for allergic reaction in sensitive individuals

name: Sandfly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Itchy bites, potential for allergic reaction

prevalence.Regional: Prevalent in certain tropical and subtropical regions

name: Blackfly Allergy
commonSymptoms: Itchy bites, local swelling, potential for allergic reaction

prevalence.Regional: Prevalent in certain regions with flowing water

name: Horse Fly Bite Allergy (Specific Species)
crossReactivity: Other horse fly species, deer flies (sometimes)

prevalence.General: Common in areas with these flies

treatment: Cold compress, topical corticosteroids, antihistamines, avoidance

name: Deer Fly Bite Allergy (Specific Species)
crossReactivity: Other deer fly species, horse flies (sometimes)

prevalence.General: Common in areas with these flies

treatment: Cold compress, topical corticosteroids, antihistamines, avoidance
